taskGroup.name: Composite cheat sheet example
taskGroup.intro:
This is an example of a composite cheat sheet built from existing cheat sheets.
You can select a task to work on either by following the hyperlinks or by selecting a task in the tree.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations you have completed all the tasks.

task.name: Branching and merging using CVS
task.intro: This cheat sheet is intended for CVS users. If you are not using CVS or do not intend to branch and merge you may skip this task.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations you now know how to branch and merge.

taskGroup.name: Create Java Projects
taskGroup.intro:
First you will learn how to create a simple java project, then you will create an java project which uses SWT.
This task group is a sequence which means that if you click on the subtask "Standalone SWT Application" it will not let that task be started until "Create a java project" has been completed.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations you have built both Java applications.

task.name: Create a java project
task.intro: This cheat sheet walks through the process of creating a simple hello world application. The cheat sheet can launch wizards to create a new project and a new class.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations you have succeeded in creating a hello world application

task.name: Standalone SWT Application
task.intro: Eclipse plugins which contribute to the user interface use The Standard Widget Toolkit (SWT). This task guide can be used to learn more about SWT.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations you have succeeded in creating an SWT application.
